00037 struct ID;
00038 struct DerivedMesh;

00049 typedef enum {
00050     /* Should not be used, only for None modifier type */
00051     eModifierTypeType_None,
00052 
00053     /* Modifier only does deformation, implies that modifier
00054      * type should have a valid deformVerts function. OnlyDeform
00055      * style modifiers implicitly accept either mesh or CV
00056      * input but should still declare flags appropriately.
00057      */
00058     eModifierTypeType_OnlyDeform,
00059 
00060     eModifierTypeType_Constructive,
00061     eModifierTypeType_Nonconstructive,
00062 
00063     /* both deformVerts & applyModifier are valid calls
00064      * used for particles modifier that doesn't actually modify the object
00065      * unless it's a mesh and can be exploded -> curve can also emit particles
00066      */
00067     eModifierTypeType_DeformOrConstruct,
00068 
00069     /* Like eModifierTypeType_Nonconstructive, but does not affect the geometry
00070      * of the object, rather some of its CustomData layers.
00071      * E.g. UVProject and WeightVG modifiers. */
00072     eModifierTypeType_NonGeometrical,
00073 } ModifierTypeType;
00074 
00075 typedef enum {
00076     eModifierTypeFlag_AcceptsMesh          = (1<<0),
00077     eModifierTypeFlag_AcceptsCVs           = (1<<1),
00078     eModifierTypeFlag_SupportsMapping      = (1<<2),
00079     eModifierTypeFlag_SupportsEditmode     = (1<<3),
00080 
00081     /* For modifiers that support editmode this determines if the
00082      * modifier should be enabled by default in editmode. This should
00083      * only be used by modifiers that are relatively speedy and
00084      * also generally used in editmode, otherwise let the user enable
00085      * it by hand.
00086      */
00087     eModifierTypeFlag_EnableInEditmode     = (1<<4),
00088 
00089     /* For modifiers that require original data and so cannot
00090      * be placed after any non-deformative modifier.
00091      */
00092     eModifierTypeFlag_RequiresOriginalData = (1<<5),
00093 
00094     /* For modifiers that support pointcache, so we can check to see if it has files we need to deal with
00095      */
00096     eModifierTypeFlag_UsesPointCache = (1<<6),
00097 
00098     /* For physics modifiers, max one per type */
00099     eModifierTypeFlag_Single = (1<<7),
00100 
00101     /* Some modifier can't be added manually by user */
00102     eModifierTypeFlag_NoUserAdd = (1<<8),
00103 
00104     /* For modifiers that use CD_PREVIEW_MCOL for preview. */
00105     eModifierTypeFlag_UsesPreview = (1<<9)
00106 } ModifierTypeFlag;
00107 
00108 typedef void (*ObjectWalkFunc)(void *userData, struct Object *ob, struct Object **obpoin);
00109 typedef void (*IDWalkFunc)(void *userData, struct Object *ob, struct ID **idpoin);
00110 typedef void (*TexWalkFunc)(void *userData, struct Object *ob, struct ModifierData *md, const char *propname);
00111 
00112 typedef struct ModifierTypeInfo {
00113     /* The user visible name for this modifier */
00114     char name[32];
00115 
00116     /* The DNA struct name for the modifier data type, used to
00117      * write the DNA data out.
00118      */
00119     char structName[32];
00120 
00121     /* The size of the modifier data type, used by allocation. */
00122     int structSize;
00123 
00124     ModifierTypeType type;
00125     ModifierTypeFlag flags;
00126 
00127 
00128     /********************* Non-optional functions *********************/
00129 
00130     /* Copy instance data for this modifier type. Should copy all user
00131      * level settings to the target modifier.
00132      */
00133     void (*copyData)(struct ModifierData *md, struct ModifierData *target);
00134 
00135     /********************* Deform modifier functions *********************/
00136 
00137     /* Only for deform types, should apply the deformation
00138      * to the given vertex array. If the deformer requires information from
00139      * the object it can obtain it from the derivedData argument if non-NULL,
00140      * and otherwise the ob argument.
00141      */
00142     void (*deformVerts)(struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00143                         struct DerivedMesh *derivedData,
00144                         float (*vertexCos)[3], int numVerts,
00145                         int useRenderParams, int isFinalCalc);
00146 
00147     /* Like deformMatricesEM but called from object mode (for supporting modifiers in sculpt mode) */
00148     void (*deformMatrices)(
00149                 struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00150                 struct DerivedMesh *derivedData,
00151                 float (*vertexCos)[3], float (*defMats)[3][3], int numVerts);
00152 
00153     /* Like deformVerts but called during editmode (for supporting modifiers)
00154      */
00155     void (*deformVertsEM)(
00156                 struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00157                 struct BMEditMesh *editData, struct DerivedMesh *derivedData,
00158                 float (*vertexCos)[3], int numVerts);
00159 
00160     /* Set deform matrix per vertex for crazyspace correction */
00161     void (*deformMatricesEM)(
00162                 struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00163                 struct BMEditMesh *editData, struct DerivedMesh *derivedData,
00164                 float (*vertexCos)[3], float (*defMats)[3][3], int numVerts);
00165 
00166     /********************* Non-deform modifier functions *********************/
00167 
00168     /* For non-deform types: apply the modifier and return a derived
00169      * data object (type is dependent on object type).
00170      *
00171      * The derivedData argument should always be non-NULL; the modifier
00172      * should read the object data from the derived object instead of the
00173      * actual object data. 
00174      *
00175      * The useRenderParams argument indicates if the modifier is being
00176      * applied in the service of the renderer which may alter quality
00177      * settings.
00178      *
00179      * The isFinalCalc parameter indicates if the modifier is being
00180      * calculated for a final result or for something temporary
00181      * (like orcos). This is a hack at the moment, it is meant so subsurf
00182      * can know if it is safe to reuse its internal cache.
00183      *
00184      * The modifier may reuse the derivedData argument (i.e. return it in
00185      * modified form), but must not release it.
00186      */
00187     struct DerivedMesh *(*applyModifier)(
00188                                 struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00189                                 struct DerivedMesh *derivedData,
00190                                 int useRenderParams, int isFinalCalc);
00191 
00192     /* Like applyModifier but called during editmode (for supporting
00193      * modifiers).
00194      * 
00195      * The derived object that is returned must support the operations that
00196      * are expected from editmode objects. The same qualifications regarding
00197      * derivedData apply as for applyModifier.
00198      */
00199     struct DerivedMesh *(*applyModifierEM)(
00200                                 struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00201                                 struct BMEditMesh *editData,
00202                                 struct DerivedMesh *derivedData);
00203 
00204 
00205     /********************* Optional functions *********************/
00206 
00207     /* Initialize new instance data for this modifier type, this function
00208      * should set modifier variables to their default values.
00209      * 
00210      * This function is optional.
00211      */
00212     void (*initData)(struct ModifierData *md);
00213 
00214     /* Should return a CustomDataMask indicating what data this
00215      * modifier needs. If (mask & (1 << (layer type))) != 0, this modifier
00216      * needs that custom data layer. This function's return value can change
00217      * depending on the modifier's settings.
00218      *
00219      * Note that this means extra data (e.g. vertex groups) - it is assumed
00220      * that all modifiers need mesh data and deform modifiers need vertex
00221      * coordinates.
00222      *
00223      * Note that this limits the number of custom data layer types to 32.
00224      *
00225      * If this function is not present or it returns 0, it is assumed that
00226      * no extra data is needed.
00227      *
00228      * This function is optional.
00229      */
00230     CustomDataMask (*requiredDataMask)(struct Object *ob, struct ModifierData *md);
00231 
00232     /* Free internal modifier data variables, this function should
00233      * not free the md variable itself.
00234      *
00235      * This function is optional.
00236      */
00237     void (*freeData)(struct ModifierData *md);
00238 
00239     /* Return a boolean value indicating if this modifier is able to be
00240      * calculated based on the modifier data. This is *not* regarding the
00241      * md->flag, that is tested by the system, this is just if the data
00242      * validates (for example, a lattice will return false if the lattice
00243      * object is not defined).
00244      *
00245      * This function is optional (assumes never disabled if not present).
00246      */
00247     int (*isDisabled)(struct ModifierData *md, int userRenderParams);
00248 
00249     /* Add the appropriate relations to the DEP graph depending on the
00250      * modifier data. 
00251      *
00252      * This function is optional.
00253      */
00254     void (*updateDepgraph)(struct ModifierData *md, struct DagForest *forest, struct Scene *scene,
00255                            struct Object *ob, struct DagNode *obNode);
00256 
00257     /* Should return true if the modifier needs to be recalculated on time
00258      * changes.
00259      *
00260      * This function is optional (assumes false if not present).
00261      */
00262     int (*dependsOnTime)(struct ModifierData *md);
00263 
00264 
00265     /* True when a deform modifier uses normals, the requiredDataMask
00266      * cant be used here because that refers to a normal layer where as
00267      * in this case we need to know if the deform modifier uses normals.
00268      * 
00269      * this is needed because applying 2 deform modifiers will give the
00270      * second modifier bogus normals.
00271      * */
00272     int (*dependsOnNormals)(struct ModifierData *md);
00273 
00274 
00275     /* Should call the given walk function on with a pointer to each Object
00276      * pointer that the modifier data stores. This is used for linking on file
00277      * load and for unlinking objects or forwarding object references.
00278      *
00279      * This function is optional.
00280      */
00281     void (*foreachObjectLink)(struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00282                               ObjectWalkFunc walk, void *userData);
00283 
00284     /* Should call the given walk function with a pointer to each ID
00285      * pointer (i.e. each datablock pointer) that the modifier data
00286      * stores. This is used for linking on file load and for
00287      * unlinking datablocks or forwarding datablock references.
00288      *
00289      * This function is optional. If it is not present, foreachObjectLink
00290      * will be used.
00291      */
00292     void (*foreachIDLink)(struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00293                           IDWalkFunc walk, void *userData);
00294 
00295     /* Should call the given walk function for each texture that the
00296      * modifier data stores. This is used for finding all textures in
00297      * the context for the UI.
00298      *
00299      * This function is optional. If it is not present, it will be
00300      * assumed the modifier has no textures.
00301      */
00302     void (*foreachTexLink)(struct ModifierData *md, struct Object *ob,
00303                           TexWalkFunc walk, void *userData);
00304 } ModifierTypeInfo;

00360 typedef struct CDMaskLink {
00361     struct CDMaskLink *next;
00362     CustomDataMask mask;
00363 } CDMaskLink;
00364 
00365 /* Calculates and returns a linked list of CustomDataMasks indicating the
00366  * data required by each modifier in the stack pointed to by md for correct
00367  * evaluation, assuming the data indicated by dataMask is required at the
00368  * end of the stack.
00369  */
00370 struct CDMaskLink *modifiers_calcDataMasks(struct Scene *scene, 
00371                                            struct Object *ob,
00372                                            struct ModifierData *md,
00373                                            CustomDataMask dataMask,
00374                                            int required_mode);
00375 struct ModifierData *modifiers_getLastPreview(struct Scene *scene,
00376                                               struct ModifierData *md,
00377                                               int required_mode);
00378 struct ModifierData  *modifiers_getVirtualModifierList(struct Object *ob);

00381 void test_object_modifiers(struct Object *ob);
